title: Basic English Grammar Test
description: Test your basic English grammar knowledge

questions.questionText: He ___ a book in the evening.
We ___ our homework in the afternoon.
She ___ to the radio in the morning.
We always ___ our teeth before bed.
She always ___ tea in the morning.

title: Level A2 Assessment
description: Comprehensive assessment of your English skills to determine A2 proficiency.

questions.questionText: I have lived in this city ___ 2010.
If it rains tomorrow, we ___ stay at home.
Could you tell me ___ the station is?
He ___ a new job last month.
There ___ a lot of people at the concert.
He can't come now because he ___ a shower.
I ___ to New York last summer.
This is the best movie I have ___ seen.
He ___ to music when I saw him.
___ you like to join us for lunch?
She ___ studying because the exam is near.
They ___ to the party last Saturday.
My brother ___ to music right now.
She always ___ her homework on time.
He ___ in the library when I called.
They ___ to the park every Sunday.
___ he coming to the party tonight?
___ you help me with this box?
They ___ tired after the long trip.
I ___ help you if you need.
We ___ a lot of fun at the party.
She ___ work at 8 a.m. every day.
They ___ planning to move next year.

title: Level B1 Assessment
description: Comprehensive assessment of your English skills to determine B1 proficiency.

questions.questionText: If I ___ time, I will visit you.
He said that he ___ finish the report by Friday.
The project ___ by the team next month.
I have been learning English ___ three years.
It's the first time I ___ sushi.
You ___ smoke here; it's a non-smoking area.
I ___ home when it started to rain.
We ___ in this apartment for five years.
They ___ a new car last weekend.
She ___ come with us if she finishes her work.
He ___ watching TV when I arrived.
She ___ to find a new job next month.
I ___ go to the party. I’m too tired.
This time next week, I ___ on a beach.
If I were you, I ___ take a break.
He was tired because he ___ all day.
By the time we arrived, the film ___.
She ___ ever been on a plane before.
We ___ to the mountains every summer.
She ___ to the store before it closed.
We ___ dinner when the phone rang.
I ___ my keys. Can you help me look for them?
He ___ TV when the lights went out.
She ___ a lot of books lately.
What ___ you do if you won the lottery?
I ___ him since we were in high school.
She ___ to visit her aunt tomorrow.
He ___ in New York for two years.
They ___ the news by the time I arrived.
I ___ a lot of mistakes in the past.
He ___ to fix the car himself.
She ___ the exam if she had studied more.

title: Advanced A1 Level Assessment
description: Evaluate basic English skills with advanced questions at A1 level.

questions.questionText: My sister ___ to music every day.

title: Vocabulary Test: Animals
description: Test your vocabulary knowledge about animals.

questions.questionText: What is this animal? [image of a cat]
Which animal makes the sound 'woof woof'?
What is a baby cat called?
Which animal has long ears and hops?
What is a baby dog called?
Which animal lives in water and has gills?
Which animal is known as the 'king of the jungle'?
Which animal has a long trunk?
What is a baby cow called?
Which animal climbs trees and eats bananas?
Which of these is a bird?
Which animal is green and hops?
What is a baby chicken called?
Which animal has a mane and roars?
Which of these is a farm animal?
Which animal has a shell and moves slowly?
Which animal lives in the desert?
Which animal is a common pet?
What do you call a male chicken?
Which animal has horns and gives us milk?
Which animal is pink and rolls in mud?
Which animal can swim and has fins?
What animal has black and white stripes?
Which of these is a wild animal?
What animal is known for jumping and has a pouch?
Which animal is big and gray with tusks?
What is the baby of a horse called?
Which animal lives in cold areas and is white?
Which animal is very tall and eats leaves?
Which of these is a sea animal?
Which animal is known to guard homes?
Which animal has feathers and can talk?
Which animal has scales and lays eggs?
What is the baby of a lion called?
Which animal can be ridden and used on farms?
Which animal builds dams and has big teeth?
Which animal is used to pull carts and plows?
Which animal is a common zoo animal?
Which animal is known for being slow?

title: Vocabulary Test: Food
description: Test your vocabulary knowledge about food.

questions.questionText: What do you call a fruit that is red and round?
Which food is made from milk?
What is a drink made from fruit?
Which of the following is a type of meat?
Which food is sweet and often eaten as dessert?
Which of these is a dairy product?
Which of these is usually eaten for breakfast?
What food is made from flour and often eaten with soup?
Which food is long, thin, and made from wheat?
Which fruit is yellow and curved?
Which food is often used on toast in the morning?
What is a healthy snack made from dried grapes?
Which of these is a fruit?
What food is green and often used in salads?
Which food is made from ground meat and is usually round?
What do you drink that is made from tea leaves?
Which sweet food is often given on Valentine's Day?
Which food is a common side dish with hamburgers?
Which of the following is a beverage?
What do you put on pancakes to make them sweet?
Which food is commonly eaten with ketchup?
Which is a type of pasta?
What is a cold food made with lettuce, tomato, and cucumber?
Which of these is frozen and sweet?
Which of these is often found in a sandwich?
Which food is white, fluffy, and eaten with many meals in Asia?
Which of the following is a citrus fruit?
Which of these is used to sweeten tea or coffee?
Which of the following is NOT a vegetable?
Which food is often used in Italian dishes?
What do you usually spread on bread for a sandwich?
What is often served as the last course of a meal?
Which food is green and shaped like a tree?
Which drink is black and has caffeine?
Which of the following is a root vegetable?
Which fruit is used to make wine?
What do you call cooked bread?
Which of these is a type of bean?
Which food is often served at breakfast with eggs?
Which of the following is fried and crunchy?
Which of these is a fruit with a hard seed inside?
Which food is often round and has cheese and toppings?
What is a common snack made from corn?
Which of these is a type of seafood?
Which of the following is a hot drink?
Which of the following is not sweet?
Which of these is used for seasoning and comes in a shaker?

title: Vocabulary Test: Family
description: Test your vocabulary knowledge about family.

questions.questionText: What do you call your father's mother?
What do you call your mother's brother?
What do you call your brother's son?
What do you call your parent's child who is not you?
What do you call your niece's brother?
What do you call your son's child?
What do you call your wife's father?
What do you call your husband's sister?
What do you call your parent's parents?
What do you call your sister's son?
What do you call your father's brother?
What do you call your mother's sister?
What do you call your sister's husband?
What do you call your wife's mother?
What do you call your son's son?
What do you call your daughter’s daughter?
What do you call your brother's wife?
What do you call your child's spouse?

title: Vocabulary Test: Travel
description: Test your vocabulary knowledge about travel.

questions.questionText: What do you need to travel to another country?
Where do you stay when you travel?
What is a person who travels called?
What do you use to carry your clothes?
What do you buy to travel by plane?
What do you look at to know where to go?
Where do planes take off and land?
What do you call a trip made for fun?
Who helps you on the plane?
What do you need to check in at the airport?
What do you call the person who flies the plane?
What do you wear to protect your eyes from the sun?
Where do you go to get information about a city?
What is the place where you wait for a train?
What do you need to stay in a hotel?
Where do you go to take a bus?
What is the opposite of departure?
What do you call a short trip to a city or landmark?
What document shows your flight and seat number?
Where do you put your bags at the airport?
Which word means ‘to go on a trip’?
What is a place where travelers sleep in large shared rooms?
Which word means to plan a place to stay?
What do you call a travel plan with times and places?
Where do you go through security at the airport?
What kind of place is famous for camping and hiking?
What do you call the bags you take with you when you travel?
Which word means to go from one country to another?
Where do people usually sunbathe and swim?
What is a journey by sea called?
What do you wear on your back to carry things while hiking?
Where do people wait to board a plane?
What is a room with a bed in a hotel called?
Which of these is NOT a means of transport?
Where can you buy local items when you travel?
What do you need to enter some countries?
What kind of place is known for museums and landmarks?
What do you do when you arrive at a hotel?
What is the last thing you do before leaving a hotel?
Where do you stay if you are camping?
Who helps you visit places and gives information?
What do you call a visit to a place of interest?
What do you need to rent a car?
What do you do before your flight to avoid waiting?
What is a building where you stay overnight on vacation?
What is a place with water and sand for relaxation?
What helps you find places in a city?
What do you pack your clothes in for a short trip?

title: Grammar Test: Present Simple
description: Test your grammar knowledge of the present simple tense.

questions.questionText: We ___ to the park on Sundays.
My parents ___ in a small village.
She always ___ her teeth before bed.
The teacher ___ us new words every day.
You always ___ your keys at home!
My dog ___ a lot of noise.
I never ___ tea in the morning.
He ___ to the gym on weekdays.
He always ___ a shower in the morning.
He usually ___ his homework after dinner.
I ___ in Ho Chi Minh City.
She ___ a cup of tea every morning.
I usually ___ to music in the evening.
They ___ at the library after class.
My sister ___ to the radio every morning.

title: Grammar Test: Past Simple
description: Test your grammar knowledge of the past simple tense.

questions.questionText: He ___ a letter to his friend.
We ___ in Paris for a week.
I ___ my wallet in the car.
We ___ a taxi to the airport.
She ___ a blue dress last night.
I ___ a great book last weekend.
I ___ my friend at the mall.

title: Grammar Test: Present Continuous
description: Test your grammar knowledge of the present continuous tense.

questions.questionText: Look! The dog ___ in the water.
I ___ my homework at the moment.
Look! The children ___ in the yard.

title: Grammar Test: Future Simple
description: Test your grammar knowledge of the future simple tense.

questions.questionText: They ___ a new car next month.
They ___ to visit us next month.
You ___ it when you see it.
I ___ a new phone next week.
